results.title: Seventh rail report: speed the payload
results.brief_description: In many aspects of railway working, modern methods and structures are making for quicker results. Shows how sending loads of coal by the Merry-go-round trains is regularising the supply to the power stations, and how the Motorail terminal at Olympia speeds the holidaymaker comfortably on his way with his car. Also demonstrates British Rail’s hovercraft service between Southampton and Cowes in the Isle of Wight.

results.title: Seventeen
results.creator_credit: Jeff Kreines, Joel DeMott, Kreines Films and DeMott
results.brief_description: A group of American working-class teenagers were filmed during their last year at high school. DeMott and Kreines filmed for more than a year and by living where they filmed, they covered a wide range of adolescent experiences. No cuts were made and the film reflects exactly what they saw.

results.title: Seven years in Tibet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Iain Smith, John H. Williams, Applecross Productions and Reperage and Vanguard Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Austrian climber Heinrich Harrer, this is the amazing true story of his friendship with the Dalai Lama. Climbing in the Himalayas, Harrer is captured as a POW in China at the start of the second world war. He manages to escape the camp and flees across the mountains into isolated Tibet. As one of the few foreigners to ever enter Tibet, Harrer forms a friendship with the young Dalai Lama and becomes his confidante. The film depicts the most tumultuous period of Tibetan history in which China invades and occupies Tibet - an oppression which continues to this day.

results.title: Seven wonders of the industrial world
results.creator_credit: Deborah Cadbury and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This seven part television series is about seven wonders of civil engineering in the industrial age and ‘modern’ world. Man-made and magnificent, the series covers the creation of the biggest steam ship ever built, the Brooklyn Bridge, the Bell Rock Lighthouse, London’s sewerage system, the Panama Canal, the trans-American Railway and the Hoover Dam. Using actors in period costume and settings, and aided by computer animation techniques, this docu-drama style telling re-enacts the language and manners of the day to impart information in a really appealing way. The trials and controversies that occur when such huge constructions are undertaken - including the loss of life - are also covered. Narrated by Robert Lindsay.

results.title: Seven till five
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and Glasgow School of Art
results.brief_description: An impressionistic live-action study of art school activities from morning to night. This was the first film of the Glasgow School of Art Film Group. It won first prize in the Second Amateur Film Festival in Glasgow, 1934. This film has no dialogue or music effects. Photographed by W.J. Maclean.

results.title: Seven shades of pale
results.creator_credit: Les Rose, William Weintraub and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From a quiet, neglected corner of Nova Scotia, a meeting with the Black community that shows both the traditional attitudes of the older generation and the more alert, resolved stance of the young. The old still pin their hopes on the church and the preacher, while the young look more towards the Black United Front and its roving director. For both generations change is a challenge. The common hope is for a fuller life.

results.title: Seven Samurai = Shichinin no samurai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: In 16th century Japan a primitive village, dreading the annual raid of bandits who carry off the harvest and the village girls, decides to hire Samurai to help defend themselves. With his help, six others are recruited. Overcoming the villagers’ fears, the Samurai begin to organise their defence. After a long period of waiting, the bandits attack. A series of violent battles follows, which ends at last in victory for the Samurai and the villagers. Hailed as one of the greatest films ever made, “Seven Samurai” was the second Kurosawa film to bring him great acclaim in the West (the first being “Rashomon”); Kurosawa presents peerless battle scenes, but he also encapsulates the humanity of the villagers’, their plight and the honour of the fearsome Samurais. Stars Toshiro Mifune and Takashi Shimura. Also available on VHS [301009].

results.title: Seven o'clock news
results.brief_description: Shows an ABC radio announcer preparing the script of the 7 o’clock news for transmission over the ABC network. A recruiting film illustrating many aspects of the work of the the PMG Department, including the provision of communications systems for radi broadcasting and the training of Post Office personnel as telegraphists, postal clerks and technicians.

results.title: Seven more stations
results.creator_credit: Victor Sheridan, Patrick Henry and Academy Picture Corporation
results.brief_description: A record of the opening of the Eastern Extension of London Transport’s Central line from Wanstead to Newbury Park, showing the planning, organisation and labour that went into the extension.
